intro: Hey there! Ready to explore the fascinating world of light and shadows? Let's test your knowledge with some fun questions!

questions.question: Which of the following objects would allow you to see a clear shadow behind it if light were shone on it?
options: B) A thin sheet of paper
questions.hint: Remember, shadows need an object that blocks light completely.

questions.question: You are standing in a park and notice your shadow. As the Sun moves higher in the sky, your shadow will:
questions.hint: Think about how the Sun's position affects your shadow during the day.

questions.question: A pin-hole camera creates an image because:
options: A) Light bounces off the object and enters the camera.
B) Light travels in straight lines and passes through the pin-hole.
C) Light bends around the pin-hole to form the image.
D) The camera itself emits light to form the image.
questions.hint: What property of light is key to a pin-hole camera's function?

followups: Try adjusting the light direction slider to see how shadows change position!
Remember, opaque objects are key for strong shadows – test different materials in the simulation!
summary: Light travels in straight lines. Opaque objects block light to make shadows, transparent objects let light pass, and translucent ones scatter it. Pin-hole cameras use straight-line travel to capture inverted images!
